We started practising the attack, ready for the big attack, this big attack that was to come
I started at dawn and went on until dusk

Then I went back to the battery

But the bombardment, when that started, it was what I always called the dance of hell
Day and night, the shells, heavy and light ones, came upon us

Author: Robert James Henderson

Location: Belgium
 Date: 25th June 1917

My dear Mum, Arrived back w
We are leading for the cricket cup having a good game against the 4th Field Ambulance yesterday whom
Humphrey Browning is back again with the Battn and several other officers so we are fairly well off
Harry  Murray saw Len while he was across in England visiting the Henley's at the Windsor Hotel told
Well I have to  go and get the team practicing for the next match also a lot of letters to censor al

collect from Valley of Death in afternoon & again out at 8 pm 2nd May Sun
Have a rest & watch the Na
Sent cablegram home via Alexandria

Rush hit on foot May 6th Thurs
Our camp under very heavy shrapnel fire all day & we crouch as far ba
Go out to left flank to see G Henderson in afternoon & have a good yarn
Have a race for life from 4th Dressing Stn, between the barricades, but see 5 shot dead and many wou
Heavy Xplosive shells sent over our camp in evening but few hurt

May 10th Mon
Hear Cuckoo, Many shells sent to our camp but nobody hit
May 13th Thurs Darcy wounded in arm (venous)

Our position shelled periodically little damage 
May 14th Friday Our position getting hell
One 3rd Batt man killed just below us and while Capt Connek & one of our squads were attending him a
7 cut through the corner of my dug out & shattered Pens right leg & tore up T Jones left leg, dig de
Take a walk in evening to left where we landed May 17th Mon Heavy shelling again
